title: Version 115 Total Bugy
content: Sorry, but since you're stubborn and don't support German, you'll have to be satisfied with the Google translator So, what's with the version 115 of TB? It constantly asks for the passwords of the accounts, although they are all present and working in the profile folder. If the developer now thinks that I am creating everything again just because the 115 version no longer wants to read the old profile, he has cut it. WE users are the ones who work with it every day and the developer can't just decide what's better, WE users are the ones who have to deal with it, so make sure you get your Schrottige115 version up and running, because NO ONE will want to use it that way. Sorry if it sounds harsh, but I'm pissed off, Mozilla has been driving TB and FDF more and more against the wall for years. NO improvements just crap.

title: i lost all my archived mail
content:
Arrgghh!

Thunderbird started to behave really weird n my mac since the update to Ventura. It was very slow, and i could not delete mails anymore, nor could i delete old profiles.

So i backed up everything and reinstalled. Usually I could just copy .msf files into the new 'local' folder and i would have my mails structured and archived again. Not this time. When I open Thunderbird it's not there and what is worse: the files have also disappeared from the 'local' folder.

So now the situation is: I have the newest Thunderbird, and all my archives with mails, including ongoing things about work, are gone. And it still is extremely slow and does not quit by key command. What is going on?

thanx for any help.

title: Thunderbird 115 now ignores my userChrome.css
content:
I have a userChrome.css to change the color of unread messages in the "list of messages" pane to orange:

/* Messagepane text */ treechildren::-moz-tree-cell-text(new) { 

       color: #34ebdc !important;        font-weight: normal;

} treechildren::-moz-tree-cell-text(unread) { 

       color: #34c6eb !important;        font-weight: normal !important;

}

This worked fine in TB 102 and prior. When I upgraded to TB 115 this no longer has any effect. I'm not sure if the userChrome.css is being ignored or if the styling elements in userChrome.css have changed.

I'm on Windows 11 and userChrome.css is located in 2 places: C:\Users\$username\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\$profile.default\chrome\userChrome.css C:\Users\$username\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles\$profile.default\chrome\userChrome.css

creator: lucian1

title: When moving a message to another account, the original should be deleted, not archived
content:
Thunderbird's behavior is illogical when moving a message from one Gmail account to another. It copies the message from Account 1 to Account 2, and then it archives the message in Account 1 instead of deleting it.

The correct action is delete, not archive. "Moving" means move from one place to another, not create a copy so that two versions begin to exist in two different places. If the user wanted to copy, he would choose copy instead of move.

Unsuspecting users use the move command without knowing that Thunderbird is actually archiving their old messages instead of deleting them. In other cases, people like me, who know that Thunderbird doesn't "move" correctly, sometimes can still select "move" instead of "copy" by mistake. The result is that you have to fish for those archived messages in Account 1's "All Mail" folder now, and if you've moved many emails that were buried deep inside the inbox, you are screwed!

This is a UX disaster. Why has this travesty gone on for so many years and why hasn't it been addressed after almost 2 decades?
creator: UserUserUserUser

title: Rearranging Accounts & Folders in TB102
content:

I originally - clearly successfully - prefixed the original addresses with 'A and B' (to beat automatic alpha-sorting) and put the one I used at the top for various reasons.

I would like to do the same for the 2 new accounts which may be different in some way, being out-sourced products. Is there any reason why not? Thanks.

title: Move messages to folders breaks after one or two moves
content: For quite a long time I have had trouble moving messages from the INBOX or SENT to my local folders. It seems random. I can select 100 messages and move them. Then do another set of messages, then upon trying another set to move nothing happens. The only fix, which works every time, is to close Thunderbird, restart, then do the move. If I do multiple moves again, the problem recurs. I compact my folders every month or so. This has happened for many many versions of Thunderbird. I am currently using 102.13.0 (64-bit) thanks Alan

title: Migrating to new PC and alternative Email
content:
I have a fairly straightforward question which might get a complicated answer? I plan to migrate from my old Win 10 Desktop PC to a new pre-installed Win11 similar. I would hope to reinstall Tbird Ver 102 and recover my (local external USB) Profiles Backup to restore normal service.

The attached screen-grab shows my current Connections and Folders profile which has evolved from my Plus.com (Plusnet) ISP having recently discontinued it's complete Email services, making my - up to then - waitrose.com address inoperative and forcing me to open a new (primary) outlook.com account with a gmail.com alternative backup.

Authentications differ I notice: Plus.net = POP 'Insecurely,' Outlook.com =IMAP 'Normal PW' and Gmail.com =IMAP 'OAuth2'.

So, might I expect my Profile backup to re-set all folders and messages - but in particular, include all curent email settings to ensure continuity of service?

title: Thunderbird 115 marking emails as read
content:
I have an issue in 115, and it seems to be with imap accounts.

No matter how I have thunderbird set to mark emails read, say after 10 seconds, or even if set not to mark emails read automatically. If I click on and email, and it opens in the reading pane, then click on to another email, the email stays shown as unread, as I would expect, however, if I move to a different mail folder, when I return to the original folder, the emails have changed to read.

Also, If I mark an email as junk, thunderbird will immediately jump to the next email, and instantly mark the new mail as read, even if I have a delay set or set to not automatically mark as read.

This is inadvertently marking emails read, even if I have no intension of dealing with them for the time being.

Anyone else notice this behaviour?

I do not see this behaviour in 102, where everything works as it should.

title: Thunderbird sporadically high processor use, consumes tons of power on idle
content:
Thunderbird 115.0 (though also happened on 102), M2 macbook pro; OS up to date.

On AC & battery, thunderbird uses up huge amounts of power sporadically in its background activity, taking up ~50-80% of processor power & hundreds of gb virtual memory (see activity monitor screenshot attached). Computer gets pretty hot to touch with thunderbird on, which I don't see with other apps. Troubleshooting info below.

This has been happening for several months now, since I switched to thunderbird & was hoping it would resolve at 115. I can't find any correlation with other usage patterns of the computer (ie I dont think it's correlated with idle usage, but not willing to stage reputation on that).

Thanks so much for any help!

creator: Shivam222

title: Select All button
content:
I have asked this same question a couple three years ago. All I got back then was push back.

So, if I may, allow me to ask again....

There used to be a Select All button available in the add-ons. But that option is no longer available.

I had presented use cases for the simple addition of a Select All button in the Customize area.

Yet all i got in response was comments like, ~if that's what you want, write your own button.~

Is this community that acrid?

So i will ask again, there seems to have been a major UI overhaul in Thunderbird of late.

And a Select All button was left out.

Should i go explore other email options?

I mean really, what is so difficult about implementing such a basic UI button in the UI?


Really....
creator: mike.543

title: Searching in TB
content: I am not sure if I am doing something wrong or if it's just a bug in Thunderbird, but when I go to search for things - for example, I know there is an email with "$17.99" quoted somewhere in the email. So I type 17.99 up in the search box, and no results are found. I, however, change my search to "Paypal" and look for that term and that will bring up several emails containing "Paypal" and within those emails I will see the email with the "17.99" quoted within it. Why does TB choose not to recognize numerical data? Thank you, John
creator: jmiller21
